intro: Phyllanthus borenensis, commonly known as the Bornean phyllanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological characteristics. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
